results.title: Channel country
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The West Queensland cattle country. This film shows the plains of South-western Queensland and the intricate network of water courses, which during the wet season flood and provide irrigation for rich natural pastures, on which large herds of cattle are fattened for marketing; but which also brings the mail, freight, news and gossip to the outlying homesteads.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Changing the record
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Examines the effects of major technological change in the newspaper industry. The issues raised have important implications for industrial relations in other industries facing technological change

results.title: Changing schools: 1912-1985
results.creator_credit: Penny Robins and Penny Robins Video Projects
results.brief_description: Using archival footage this video raises a variety of issues relevant to contemporary educational debate in both Victoria and Australia at large. Topics addressed include the need for education to change, the role of government schools, equal educational opportunity, the integration of disabled children, Aboriginal education, multiculturalism and parent participation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Penny Robins and Penny Robins Video Projects

results.title: Changing places: a social studies resource
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A series of vignettes which show the contrasts that exist between groups within a modern industrial society - between the rich and poor, the free and the imprisoned, etc.

results.title: Changing horizons
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Bushwalking in Australia means leaving the beaten tracks and venturing into the wild, rugged mountain country, with little more than the pursuit of adventure as the motive, and good healthy exercise and the companionship of fellow walkers, the rewards. The film includes scenes of Lamington National Park, Queensland, the upper reaches of the Yarra in Victoria’s Warburton Ranges, and the Blue Mountains in New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Changing art in a changing world (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Through a wide range of visual experience this film shows that the entire world in which we live is in a constant state of change. For artists, change is enormously important. It compels them to study their subject carefully, to change and modify ideas so as to express themself in their art in the best possible way.

results.title: Changes, changes (K)
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Set to the music of an all-wood orchestra, this simple un narrated story portrays a pair of wooden dolls which magically come to life. Initially the blocks formed a house for the man and lady. They then change into a fire engine to put out a fire in the house and into a truck, train and ship to take the wooden couple on a holiday. Finally they form a house again. Adapted from the book of the same title by Pat Hutchins. Animation by Zdenka Skripkova. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Changes in its surface
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
Uses the illustration of an erupting volcano to show that the surface of the earth is changing. Explains and demonstrates other forces both internal and external that are changing the earth’s surface.
